CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4-9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. low band gap conjugated polymers
2. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
3. [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)

These are the Material Name entities in the paragraph. They are identified as the donor (low band gap conjugated polymers) and acceptor materials (PC61BM and PC71BM) in the BHJ devices.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. low band gap conjugated polymers
2. PC61BM
3. PC71BM

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to Material Names. The other entities in the paragraph, such as "Typical BHJ devices," "phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer," and "fullerene derivatives," do not directly refer to specific Material Names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| low band gap conjugated polymers |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4-9 Typical BHJ devices comprise a phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer with low band gap conjugated polymers as the electron donor , and fullerene derivatives such as [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as the electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. BHJ devices
2. phaseseparated donor / acceptor blend layer
3. low band gap conjugated polymers (this could be considered as a type of donor)
4. electron donor
5. fullerene derivatives
6. [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM)
7. electron acceptor
8. [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. low band gap conjugated polymers (type of donor material)
2. fullerene derivatives (type of acceptor material)
3. PC61BM (specific acceptor material)
4. PC71BM (specific acceptor material)

These entities are relevant as they clearly refer to the material properties of the donor and acceptor in the BHJ devices.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| low band gap conjugated polymers (type of donor material) |
| fullerene derivatives (type of acceptor material) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) (specific acceptor material) |
| [6,6]-phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) (specific acceptor material) |
